meanings.definition: Talk rapidly and excitedly, often in a nonsensical or incomprehensible way.
meanings.sent1: During the party, the children would jabber about their favorite toys.
meanings.sent2: She tends to jabber when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started to jabber in a funny voice, mimicking the guests.
meanings.sent4: The old radio jabbered on, its signal fading in and out.
meanings.sent5: The excited fans would jabber endlessly about the upcoming concert.

meanings.definition: A rapid, excited, and often incomprehensible speech or chatter.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was filled with the jabber of students discussing the project.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't concentrate with all the jabber going on around me.
meanings.sent3: The jabber of monkeys in the zoo made the visitors smile.
meanings.sent4: The jabber of the crowd at the sports event was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The constant jabber of the radio host kept listeners entertained during the drive.
